title: can you get perma banned for saying "kys"
body:
Using my alt acc for this, but can you get banned for saying kys. I just told this guy who purposely ran it down that and he said he would report me. I already got a chat restriction, will I get a 14-day ban or a permanent one?

I'm not even sorry, he deserved it.
Like he was not okay in the head.

> [{quoted}](name=R107 Games,realm=NA,application-id=ZGEFLEUQ,discussion-id=kxHMfgE8,comment-id=0004,timestamp=2019-07-26T05:52:28.138+0000)

>  100% factually incorrect. Do not listen to this person.

Can you provide more information on this? How do you know it's false? Has there been a statement from Riot?

> Can you provide more information on this? How do you know it's false? Has there been a statement from Riot?

 Well, the phrases are labeled as "zero-tolerance phrases." [Here's Riot Tantram using the phrase himself. ](https://boards.na.leagueoflegends.com/en/c/player-behavior-moderation/OeZ3ipZB-got-a-14-day-suspension-by-a-teammate-on-purpose?show=flat&page=2) The name alone suggests you can't ever use them. 

 In addition to that, the Riot support website's FAQ on the [Instant Feedback System](https://support.riotgames.com/hc/en-us/articles/207489286) specifically states:

>##WHY DID I SKIP RESTRICTIONS?

>"We have a zero-tolerance policy for extreme negative behavior as well as extremely offensive language and remarks made in game towards other players. Since it is a severe disregard for the Summoner’s Code this sort of behavior can result in skipping to a Two week or Permanent suspension. Suspensions of this degree based on negative behavior will not likely be reduced or removed."

 Which again displays Riot's use of the phrase "zero-tolerance" and "extremely offensive language" would encompass things like racism, homophobia, or inciting self-harm. 

 Finally, the only "evidence" some people have (if you can even call it that) is anecdotal. They have a few links to cases where people weren't given proper punishments for the language that was used. This is incorrect and irrelevant for three reasons:

_______

1 - As I understand it (I could be wrong) the IFS doesn't punish for rulebreaking behavior that hasn't been reported. Simply put if you report a player only for standard negative behavior, it won't give them the correct punishment if they were to use hate speech. So rather than receiving a 14-day ban, they receive a 10-game chat restriction instead. 

Like I said this could be wrong, it just seems to be the case sometimes. 

_________

2 - Logically, it doesn't make sense for Riot to allow these phrases and punish them inconsistently. Why do some people get 14-day bans (correct punishment for zero tolerance language) when others only receive 10-game chat restrictions? Errors can occur, punishments can take time to be doled out, and in rare cases a manual review is needed. 

________

3 - As mentioned above, the people supporting ZT language can only provide _anecdotal_ evidence.

 I've been using the Boards a _lot_ longer than most and I can tell you with certainty that 95%+ of cases where zero-tolerance phrases have been used were dealt with correctly. The 5% of other cases were missed or handled incorrectly due to reasons 1 and 2.

 But of course, those 5% of cases are enough for some people to form incorrect bases for reasoning.

That thread brings back memories. There's Halcyon(wondered what happened to him.) and Tantram saying "will be held accountable".

 You're assuming things in point 2 and I treat manual reviews and the IFS as two different things.

The only way to prove 3 is by using 2 accounts. And using a ZT once in account 1 and getting your premade to report you,and then using 2 ZT's on account 2 and also getting reporting.

Generally, yes. Things like suicide encouragement fall under "zero tolerance" language, and subsequently result in escalations past the standard progression in the vast majority of cases, if not every time. Based on my understanding of the system, it *may* (or may not) be more lenient if it's a single instance across dozens/hundreds of games, though that is mostly speculation based on information provided by Riot and what I've seen in certain cases. Generally, Riot will only be harsher on newer accounts if they can be identified as alternate accounts from users who've exhibited such behaviours previously (and mainly those who've previously been banned).

Worst comes to worst, you're looking at a 14-day ban, and if that happens it may just be a good idea to disable both "all" and "team" chat in the games options, if you think that's going to be effective for you.

If you had a 14 day ban before (not too long time ago), then perma. If not, or it was very long time ago (and you played a lot of games), then 14 day ban.
